item.title: Amazon blocks 1,800 job applications from suspected North Korean agents
item.description: The firm’s chief security officer said North Koreans tried to apply for remote working IT jobs using stolen or fake identities.

item.title: India's jobs guarantee scheme: A global model under threat?
item.description: India’s rural jobs guarantee, a global model, faces controversy as a new law reshapes the original scheme.

item.title: Screams for help and panic as tourists rescued from fatal Laos ferry disaster
item.description: People scrambled to safety as the ferry sank on the Mekong River, with a local woman and two children feared dead.

item.title: Amazon blocks 1,800 job applications from suspected North Korean agents
item.description: Amazon's chief security officer said North Koreans tried to apply for remote working IT jobs using stolen or fake identities.

item.title: English councils warned against adopting four-day week
item.description: Local Government Secretary Steve Reed has told council leaders to not introduce four-day working weeks.

item.title: UK white Christmas unlikely despite a chilly festive forecast
item.description: Colder weather is heading our way this week but it is unlikely to bring widespread snow.

item.title: What do Christmas cracker jokes do to our brains?
item.description: Experts say cracker jokes are more about the sharing of a moment than the quality of the gag.

item.title: New era for weight-loss drugs after US approves pill version of Wegovy
item.description: Wegovy becomes first pill of its kind to be approved, shifting weight-loss drugs beyond injections.

item.title: Trump says US is pursuing third oil tanker linked to Venezuela
item.description: The move comes days after the US president said that he was ordering a blockade of sanctioned oil tankers entering and leaving Venezuela.

item.title: Sports stars fear disappearance of playing fields amid reforms
item.description: A host of top sports stars and governing bodies express fears that playing fields across England could be built on and disappear if proposed planning reforms come into force.

item.title: Trump unveils plans for 'Golden Fleet' battleships named after himself
item.description: The US president has vowed to revive American shipbuilding after lagging behind China in naval capacity.

item.title: The showers and baths keeping data centre tech cool
item.description: Finding greener ways to keep giant new data centres cool is a challenge.

item.title: The Papers: 'Chris Rea dies at Xmas' and 'King of Industry'
item.description: Tributes to late singer Chris Rea dominate the front pages of Tuesday's papers.

item.title: US regulator approves pill form of Wegovy weight-loss drug
item.description: Wegovy becomes first pill of its kind to be approved, shifting weight-loss drugs beyond injections.

item.title: The police report of my sexual assault was published by the tabloids
item.description: Jenny Evans funnelled her anger into training to become a journalist and uncover the truth.

item.title: Royal Christmas cards have a touchy-feely look this year
item.description: Correspondent Sean Coughlan takes a look at the themes in some of this year's royal cards from across Europe.

item.title: Our son can't come home for Christmas after insulation mould took over
item.description: Mr and Mrs Wadley's 19-year-old son has asthma and cannot come home for Christmas due to mould all over the walls.

item.title: What the underwhelming Epstein files release means for Trump and Maga
item.description: Conservative influencers were conspicuously silent following the latest release - but political danger remains for the president.

item.title: Trump says US 'has to have' Greenland after naming special envoy
item.description: Denmark warns Washington to respect its sovereignty, while Greenland says it will decide its own future.

item.title: 2025 likely to be UK's hottest on record, says Met Office
item.description: Scientists could not be clearer that human-caused climate change is driving the UK's warming trend.
